meanings.definition: Certain to succeed or be effective.
meanings.sent1: Her plan was surefire and everyone knew it would work.
meanings.sent2: Using a surefire method, he aced the test without any doubts.
meanings.sent3: The magician's surefire trick never failed to impress the audience.
meanings.sent4: His surefire determination was like a beacon of light in the darkness of uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The coach's surefire strategy led the team to victory every time.

meanings.definition: Guaranteed to work or happen; reliable.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic's surefire solution fixed the car in no time.
meanings.sent2: Having a surefire backup plan gave her peace of mind during the project.
meanings.sent3: The surefire alarm clock made sure he never overslept again.
meanings.sent4: The surefire friendship between them was unbreakable, like a bond of steel.
meanings.sent5: The guide's surefire directions ensured they reached their destination without any confusion.
